dublinCore.dc:title: 113 HR 3806 RH: Great Smoky Mountains National Park Agreement Act of 2014
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mr. Meadows introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Natural Resources
Reported with amendments, committed to the Committee of the Whole House on the State of the Union, and ordered to be printed
action.action-instruction: Strike out all after the enacting clause and insert the part printed in italic
For text of introduced bill, see copy of bill as introduced on December 23, 2013

form.official-title: To authorize payment of funds in accordance with the agreement entered into by the Tennessee Valley Authority, the State of North Carolina, Swain County, North Carolina, and the United States Department of the Interior.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Great Smoky Mountains National Park Agreement Act of 2014.

From funds previously appropriated to the National Park Service in the construction account for that agency in the Consolidated Appropriations Act, 2012 (Public Law 112–74), the National Park Service shall transfer $4,000,000 to counties within Great Smoky Mountains National Park in accordance with the Memorandum of Agreement entered into by the Tennessee Valley Authority and the United States Department of the Interior, dated February, 2010, that supersedes the agreement of July 30, 1943.

bill.official-title-amendment: Amend the title so as to read: A bill to authorize a settlement in accordance with the agreement entered into by the Tennessee Valley Authority and the United States Department of the Interior, and counties within the Great Smoky Mountains National Park..

endorsement.action-desc: Reported with amendments, committed to the Committee of the Whole House on the State of the Union, and ordered to be printed
